medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Microscopic hematuria was detected 14 years earlier during an episode of cystitis. The patient has had several episodes of cystitis each year, but the hematuria persisted after treatment of infections. The hematuria usually showed 10 to 20 red cells per high-power field on urine examination, occasionally exceeding 100. There was also trace to 1+ proteinuria. The patient has not had cystitis episodes for three years prior to the nephrology evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, and mild hypertension (systolic blood pressure 120 to 144 mm Hg and diastolic 70 to 96 mm Hg). A thyroidectomy for goiter performed at age 13 and current treatment with levothyroxine.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypertension and died at 72 from a stroke. Mother has diabetes. One brother died at 46 from renal failure reportedly due to analgesic use for gout. Two sisters have hematuria; one has a history of hypertension and the other has goiter.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a native of the Philippines, emigrated at 26 years of age, and works as a nurse.
